Dibanding Tabebuya, Pemprov DKI Disarankan Tanam Pohon Khas DKI di Cikini
04 Nov 2019, 18:49 by Danu Damarjati
Jakarta - Pohon-pohon di depan Stasiun Cikini, Jakarta Pusat, telah ditebang. Muncul rencana dari Pemerintah Provinsi DKI menanam pohon tabebuya usai penebangan angsana itu. Namun ada saran, sebaiknya Pemprov DKI menanam pohon khas Jakarta ketimbang pohon dari Brasil itu.
"Pemilihan tabebuya lebih karena mengikuti tren saja serta ketersediaan di pasaran," kata pengamat perkotaan dari Universitas Trisakti, Nirwono Joga, kepada wartawan, Senin (4/11/2019).
Pohon tabebuya (Handroanthus chrysotrichus) dari Brasil itu belakangan ini memang banyak ditanam di berbagai kota di Indonesia, termasuk Jakarta. Sebenarnya Jakarta sendiri punya pohon-pohon yang khas. Nirwono menyebut pohon khas Jakarta itu adalah pohon marunda (Mangifera laurina), menteng (Baccaurea racemosa), cempaka putih (Michelia alba), dan kemang (Mangifera caecea). Tanaman khas Jakarta itu bisa ditanam di lingkungan trotoar.
"Bisa sekali menanam pohon khas Jakarta. Kan dulu sudah ada banyak, makanya pohon-pohon itu jadi nama/identitas kawasan di Jakarta," tutur Nirwono.
Tabebuya sendiri dinilainya sebagai pohon yang lebih kecil ketimbang pohon yang kini ditebang, angsana (Pterocarpus indicus). Karena ukurannya, pohon angsana lebih efektif berhadapan dengan polusi ketimbang tabebuya.
"Dibandingkan dengan tabebuya, kategori pohon kecil, sedangkan angsana yang merupakan pohon besar tentu memiliki fungsi ekologis lebih baik ketimbang tabebuya, misal daya serap gas polutan, keteduhan dan iklim mikro, produksi oksigen. Daun pohon angsana lebih lebat dan tajuknya lebih lebar, serta berusia lama, ratusan tahun," tutur Nirwono.

Compared to Tabebuya, DKI Provincial Government is Suggested to Plant DKI Special Trees in Cikini
Nov 04 2019, 18:49 by Danu Damarjati
Jakarta - Trees in front of Cikini Station, Central Jakarta, have been cut down. A plan emerged from the DKI Provincial Government to plant a tabebuya tree after the angsana felling. However, there is a suggestion that the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government should plant a typical Jakarta tree rather than a tree from Brazil.
"The selection of tabebuya is more due to following trends and availability in the market," urban observer from Trisakti University, Nirwono Joga, told reporters on Monday (11/04/2019).
Tabebuya tree (Handroanthus chrysotrichus) from Brazil lately is widely planted in various cities in Indonesia, including Jakarta. Actually Jakarta itself has unique trees. Nirwono said that the typical Jakarta tree is the marunda tree (Mangifera laurina), menteng (Baccaurea racemosa), white cempaka (Michelia alba), and kemang (Mangifera caecea). Jakarta's special plants can be planted in the sidewalk environment.
"It is very possible to plant Jakarta's special trees. There used to be a lot, so the trees became the name / identity of the area in Jakarta," Nirwono said.
Tabebuya itself is considered as a smaller tree than the tree now cut down, angsana (Pterocarpus indicus). Because of its size, angsana trees are more effective in dealing with pollution than tabebuya.
"Compared to tabebuya, the small tree category, while angsana which is a large tree certainly has better ecological functions than tabebuya, for example the absorption capacity of pollutant gases, shade and microclimate, oxygen production. hundreds of years, "said Nirwono.
